intro: Echeandia williamsii, commonly known as the Williams' echeandia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Echeandia williamsii is often found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
